org.kocakosm.pitaya.io

Class ByteStreams

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kocakosm.pitaya.io.ByteStreams

  • public final class ByteStreams
extends Object
    Byte streams utilities.
    Author:
    Osman KOCAK

    • Method Detail

      • concat

        public static InputStream concat(InputStream... streams)
        Concatenates the given InputStreams into a single one. The given streams will be read sequentially. Closing the concatenated stream will close all the source streams. Note that the returned InputStream is not thread-safe and does not support InputStream.mark(int) and InputStream.reset().
        Parameters:
        streams - the streams to concatenate.
        Returns:
        the concatenated InputStream.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if streams is null or if it contains a null reference.
        IllegalArgumentException - if streams is empty.

      • concat

        public static InputStream concat(Iterable<? extends InputStream> streams)
        Concatenates the given InputStreams into a single one. The given streams will be read sequentially. Closing the concatenated stream will close all the source streams. Note that the returned InputStream is not thread-safe and does not support InputStream.mark(int) and InputStream.reset().
        Parameters:
        streams - the streams to concatenate.
        Returns:
        the concatenated InputStream.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if streams is null or if it contains a null reference.
        IllegalArgumentException - if streams is empty.

      • copy

        public static void copy(InputStream in,
                        OutputStream out)
                 throws IOException
        Copies the content of the given InputStream into the given OutputStream.
        Parameters:
        in - the stream to read from.
        out - the stream to write on.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the process.

      • equal

        public static boolean equal(InputStream in1,
                            InputStream in2)
                     throws IOException
        Returns whether the given streams have the same content.
        Parameters:
        in1 - the first stream.
        in2 - the second stream.
        Returns:
        true if the streams have the same content.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the process.

      • limit

        public static InputStream limit(InputStream in,
                                long limit)
        Returns an InputStream that will only supply bytes from the given InputStream up to the specified limit. The returned InputStream is thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        in - the source stream.
        limit - the maximum number of bytes to be read from in.
        Returns:
        the length-limited InputStream.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if in is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if limit is negative.

      • read

        public static byte[] read(InputStream in)
                   throws IOException
        Reads the content of the given InputStream.
        Parameters:
        in - the stream to read.
        Returns:
        the stream's content.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if in is null.
        IOException - if in can't be read.

      • tee

        public static OutputStream tee(OutputStream... streams)
        Returns an OutputStream that writes all bytes written to it to the given underlying streams. Named after the Unix 'tee' command. The returned instance is not thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        streams - the streams to write to.
        Returns:
        the 'tee' OutputStream.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if streams is null or if it contains a null reference.

      • tee

        public static OutputStream tee(Iterable<? extends OutputStream> streams)
        Returns an OutputStream that writes all bytes written to it to the given underlying streams. Named after the Unix 'tee' command. The returned instance is not thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        streams - the streams to write to.
        Returns:
        the 'tee' OutputStream.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if streams is null or if it contains a null reference.
